titleInfo.title: USA v. Figueroa-Valdez et al
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER granting 11 Motion for Enlargement of Time Within Which to File Pretrial Motions as to Grady Vaughn. Pretrial motions shall be filed on or before June 1, 2005. Defendant is ordered to file a waiver of speedy trial as soon as practicable. The time between May 16, 2005 and June 1, 2005, shall be deemed excludable time in any computation of time under the requirement of the Speedy Trial Act. Signed by Magistrate Judge F. A. Gossett on 5/17/2005. (MLF, )

titleInfo.title: USA v. Figueroa-Valdez et al
titleInfo.subTitle: JUDGMENT as to Grady Vaughn (2), Count(s) 1, Defendant pleaded guilty to count I of the Indictment and is sentenced to 70 months in the Bureau of Prisons followed by 5 years of Supervised Release; $100.00 special assessment to be paid immediately; Count(s) 3,4& 5 Dismissed on the motion of the government, defendant to self-surrender to the designated Bureau of Prisons institution on or after 1/4/06 as to defendant(s) Grady Vaughn. Signed by Judge Joseph F. Bataillon on 12/8/2005. (4 cert copies to US Marshal) (PCV, )

Signed by Judge Joseph F. Bataillon on 12/8/2005. (4 cert copies to US Marshal) (PCV, )

titleInfo.title: USA v. Figueroa-Valdez et al
titleInfo.subTitle: JUDGMENT as to Juan Figueroa-Valdez (1): Defendant pleaded guilty to Count I of the Indictment and is committed to the custody of the Bureau of Prisons for a term of 87 months; 5 years supervised release with special conditions; $100.00 special assessment. Count II of the Indictment is dismissed on the motion of the United States as to this defendant only, as to defendant Juan Figueroa-Valdez. Signed by Judge Joseph F. Bataillon on 3/2/2006. 4 certified copies USM (JAE, )

Count II of the Indictment is dismissed on the motion of the United States as to this defendant only, as to defendant Juan Figueroa-Valdez. Signed by Judge Joseph F. titleInfo.title: USA v. Figueroa-Valdez et al
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER regarding MOTION for Hearing59 - Counsel for the government shall notify the court when the motion pursuant to Rule 35(b) is ripe for decision. The motion shall not be decided until counsel for the government certifies that the motion is ripe. Counsel for the defendant, if previously appointed pursuant to the Criminal Justice Act, is reappointed to represent the defendant for purposes of the Rule 35(b) motion. If retained, counsel for the defendant remains as counsel for the defendant until the Rule 35(b) motion is resolved or until given leave to withdraw. The Federal Public Defender shall provide CJA counsel with a new voucher as to defendant Grady Vaughn. Ordered by Judge Joseph F. Bataillon.(TJS)

extension.searchTitle: USCOURTS 8:05-cr-00167; USA v. Figueroa-Valdez et al;
extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska
extension.docketText: ORDER regarding MOTION for Hearing59 - Counsel for the government shall notify the court when the motion pursuant to Rule 35(b) is ripe for decision. The motion shall not be decided until counsel for the government certifies that the motion is ripe. Counsel for the defendant, if previously appointed pursuant to the Criminal Justice Act, is reappointed to represent the defendant for purposes of the Rule 35(b) motion. If retained, counsel for the defendant remains as counsel for the defendant until the Rule 35(b) motion is resolved or until given leave to withdraw. The Federal Public Defender shall provide CJA counsel with a new voucher as to defendant Grady Vaughn. Ordered by Judge Joseph F. Bataillon.(TJS)

titleInfo.title: USA v. Figueroa-Valdez et al
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER - A hearing on the government's Rule 35 motion is scheduled for hearing before the undersigned on October 11, 2007, at 2:00 p.m. in Courtroom No. 3, Roman L. Hruska U.S. Courthouse, 111 South 18th Plaza, Omaha, Nebraska. At the request of the defendant through his counsel, and with the agreement of the government, the defendant may be absent from the hearing on the Rule 35 motion. The Marshal will not return the defendant to the district, and the defendant is held to have waived his right to be present. If the defendant wishes to participate telephonically in the hearing, his attorney must notify chambers at least 24 hours before the hearing of the telephone number and contact person at the institution which defendant is incarceratedas to defendant Grady Vaughn. Ordered by Judge Joseph F. Bataillon. (certified copy to USM)(TJS)

titleInfo.title: USA v. Figueroa-Valdez et al
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER regarding PETITION FOR OFFENDER UNDER SUPERVISION 67 as to defendant Grady Vaughn. The defendant should be held to answer for a final dispositional hearing before Chief Judge Bataillon. A final dispositional hearing will be held before Chief Judge Joseph F. Bataillon in Courtroom No.3, Third Floor, Roman L. Hruska U.S. Courthouse, 111 South 18th Plaza, Omaha, Nebraska, on September 3, 2009 at 2:30 p.m. Defendant must be present in person. The defendant is released on current conditions of supervision. Ordered by Magistrate Judge F. A. Gossett. (MLF, )
